handlers

Class TextHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • handlers.TextHandler

  • public class TextHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    A Text Handler for JavaFX. This class can be used to display text of user-specified placement, size, wrapping, font and color to a javafx.scene.lauput.StackPane. The text can be passed directly or read from a file.
    Author:
    Joel Fergusson

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TextHandler()
      Creates a text handler with the default black, opaque text of size 10, family times new roman.
      TextHandler(javafx.scene.paint.Color defaultColor, javafx.scene.text.Font defaultFont)
      Creates a TextHandler using the specified default color and font.

      Adds a text element that will be displayed at the specified points, wrapped (0-1 relative to the size of the pane).

      Adds a pre-constructed text element to the handler to be displayed when display() is called.

      Adds a text element with text from the specified file.

      Adds a text element with text from the specified file.
      void display(javafx.scene.layout.StackPane pane)
      Displays all the text elements that have been added to the TextHandler on the specified pane.

      Sets the default color for all text elements added after this function is executed.

      • addTextElementByFile

        public void addTextElementByFile(java.lang.String filename,
                        double xpos,
                        double ypos,
                        double wrappingWidth)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Adds a text element with text from the specified file. Will display it at the specified points, wrapped (0-1 relative to the size of the pane). If the file cannot be found, an IOException will be thrown. Uses the object's defaults for font and color, with no timeout.
        Parameters:
        filename - Name of file containing text to display.
        xpos - x position of text (0-1 relative to pane width)
        ypos - y position of text (0-1 relative to pane height)
        wrappingWidth - wrapping width (0-1 relative to pane width, 0 disables wrapping.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be found, or another IO error occurs when reading the file, this exception will be thrown.

      • addTextElementByFile

        public void addTextElementByFile(java.lang.String filename,
                        double xpos,
                        double ypos,
                        double wrappingWidth,
                        javafx.scene.paint.Color color,
                        javafx.scene.text.Font font,
                        double timeout)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Adds a text element with text from the specified file. Will display it at the specified points, wrapped (0-1 relative to the size of the pane). Uses the specified font and color. If the file cannot be found, an IOException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        filename - Name of file containing text to display.
        xpos - x position of text (0-1 relative to pane width)
        ypos - y position of text (0-1 relative to pane height)
        wrappingWidth - wrapping width (0-1 relative to pane width, 0 disables wrapping.
        color - Color of text
        font - Font of text
        timeout - Time for which text will be displayed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be found, or another IO error occurs when reading the file, this exception will be thrown.

      • addTextElement

        public void addTextElement(java.lang.String text,
                  double xpos,
                  double ypos,
                  double wrappingWidth)
        Adds a text element that will be displayed at the specified points, wrapped (0-1 relative to the size of the pane). Uses the object's defaults for font and color, with no timeout.
        Parameters:
        text - String to be displayed
        xpos - x position of text (0-1 relative to pane width)
        ypos - y position of text (0-1 relative to pane height)
        wrappingWidth - wrapping width (0-1 relative to pane width, 0
